movies.title: The Gentleman from Epsom
movies.plot: The story takes place in the racecourses around Paris. A so-called major sells his tips to naive characters.
movies.simplePlot: The story takes place in the racecourses around Paris. A so-called major sells his tips to naive characters.

biography.bio: Jean-Alexis Moncorge started his career with 15 years at the theatre and debuted at the "Moulin Rouge" in Paris in 1929. Despite of his rude aspect he knew to be the gentleman of the French cinema in the time between the two World Wars. One of his most popular personalities was inspector Maigret. But he was also able to play all other kind of people: aristocrats, farmers, thieves and managers. He never stopped working and when death surprised him in 1976 he was still an institution for the French audience.
biography.name: Jean Gabin

biography.bio: Madeleine Robinson was born on November 5, 1916 in Paris, France as Madeleine Yvonne Svoboda. She was an actress, known for Camille Claudel (1988), The Trial (1962) and Leda (1959). She was married to Guillaume Amestoy and Robert Dalban. She died on August 1, 2004 in Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland.
biography.name: Madeleine Robinson

biography.bio: Frank Villard was born on March 24, 1917 in Saint-Jean-d'Angély, Charente-Maritime, France as François Drouineau. He was an actor, known for Apocalypse Now (1979), La violetera (1958) and Savage Triangle (1951). He died on September 19, 1980 in Geneva, Switzerland.
biography.name: Frank Villard

biography.bio: Jean Lefebvre was born on October 3, 1919 in Valenciennes, Nord, France as Jean Marcel Lefebvre. He was an actor, known for Diabolique (1955), Le gendarme se marie (1968) and The Troops on Vacation (1970). He was married to Brigitte Lerebours, Yori Bertin and Micheline Grasser. He died on July 9, 2004 in Marrakech, Morocco.
biography.name: Jean Lefebvre

biography.bio: Short, stocky Jacques Marin was a wonderfully droll character actor, who tended to pop up in international films of the 60's and 70's, whenever a typically French-looking gendarme, police inspector, concierge or shopkeeper was needed. His trademark was a toothbrush moustache and a deadpan expression -- except for a perpetually reproving frown -- which suggested deeper thought processes were going on. Despite all his overt seriousness, his characters were usually amusing, or, at least, likeable. A fluent English-speaker, he effortlessly alternated between French and English-language productions, beginning with The Vintage (1957). He is also fondly remembered as the ineffectual Inspector Grandpierre in Charade (1963), as Major Duvalle in Darling Lili (1970), and as Massenet, one of the potential culinary victims in Ted Kotcheff's black comedy Who Is Killing the Great Chefs of Europe? (1978). While the majority of Marin's prolific career consisted of little more than small supporting roles and cameos, his was one of the faces you'd remember at the end of the film. Marin had studied acting at the Conservatoire national superieur d'art dramatique de Paris and made his feature debut in the war drama Forbidden Games (1952). He often appeared alongside Jean Gabin and was a frequent performer on stage at the Theatre Marigny and the Celestins Theatre in Lyon. Over the decades, he provided many a memorable moment in French film, including in Youthful Sinners (1958), Love Is My Profession (1958), Fantômas se déchaîne (1965) and in Trois hommes sur un cheval (1969).
biography.name: Jacques Marin

biography.bio: Jean Martinelli was born on August 15, 1910 in Paris, France. He was an actor, known for To Catch a Thief (1955), The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976) and Rouge et noir (1954). He died on March 13, 1983 in Paris.
biography.name: Jean Martinelli

biography.bio: Joëlle Bernard was born on August 14, 1928 in Vitry-le-François, Marne, France as Josette Jeanne Marie Petot. She was an actress, known for Diary of a Chambermaid (1964), Price of Love (1955) and Children of Love (1953). She was married to Roger Pigaut. She died on March 23, 1977 in Nogent-sur-Marne, Val-de-Marne, France.
biography.name: Joëlle Bernard

biography.bio: Aline Bertrand is an actress, known for The Two of Us (1967), Diary of a Chambermaid (1964) and Banzaï (1983).
biography.name: Aline Bertrand

biography.bio: Léonce Corne was born on March 18, 1894 in Beauvais, Oise, France. He was an actor, known for Alexandre le bienheureux (1968), Before the Deluge (1954) and Le ciel est à vous (1944). He died on December 31, 1977 in Chartres, Eure-et-Loir, France.
biography.name: Léonce Corne

biography.bio: Marie-Hélène Dasté was born on December 2, 1902 in Lyngly, Denmark as Marie-Hélène Copeau. She was an actress and costume designer, known for Le point du jour (1949), Who Killed Santa Claus? (1941) and Les anges du péché (1943). She was married to Jean Dasté. She died on August 28, 1994 in Beaune, Côte-d'Or, France.
biography.name: Marie-Hélène Dasté

biography.bio: Albert Dinan was born on March 27, 1902 in Paris, France as Albert Edouard Ferdinand Neuzillet. He was an actor, known for The Law Is the Law (1958), Les Bonnes Femmes (1960) and Four in a Jeep (1951). He died on July 3, 1976 in Paris.
biography.name: Albert Dinan

biography.placeOfBirth: Belfort, Territoire de Belfort, Franche-Comté, France
biography.bio: Paul Faivre was born on March 3, 1886 in Belfort, Territoire de Belfort, Franche-Comté, France as Henri Paul Faivre. He was an actor, known for ...And God Created Woman (1956), The Long Absence (1961) and Ni vu, ni connu (1958). He died on March 5, 1973 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Paul Faivre

biography.bio: Camille Fournier was born in 1905. She is known for her work on L'homme aux oiseaux (1952), The Third Cry (1974) and The Madman (1970). She died in 1989.
biography.name: Camille Fournier

biography.bio: Paul Mercey was born on January 10, 1923 in Belgrade, Serbia, Yugoslavia as Paul Georges Muller. He was an actor, known for Astérix et la surprise de César (1985), The Tattoo (1968) and La Grande Vadrouille (1966). He died on January 7, 1988 in Férolles-Attily, Seine-et-Marne, France.
biography.name: Paul Mercey

biography.bio: Alexandre Rignault was born on February 14, 1901 in Paris, France as Alexandre Paul Rignault. He was an actor, known for Eyes Without a Face (1960), My American Uncle (1980) and The Return of Don Camillo (1953). He died on April 2, 1985 in Saint-Mandé, Val-de-Marne, France.
biography.name: Alexandre Rignault

filmingLocations.location: Studios de Saint-Maurice, Saint-Maurice, Val-de-Marne, France
